name: La Quinta Inn Milwaukee Airport / Oak Creek

reviews.text: We arrived here at the end of 12 days of travel around the UP. We needed a place to stay that was close to the airport and we were pleasantly surprised. Front desk staff were very accomodating in helping us with directions to restraunts, and fireworks for July 4th. There is a Applebee's next door but if your willing to take a short drive, you'll find other selections. We chose Beer Belly's - it was a delightful place for ribs, burgers, chicken and the like. There is a movie theatre close by too. As the hotel does not have a pool, and is not near anything to visit, this is really just a place to stay if your heading to the airport. We did not hear planes all night, so I'd say either the location or soundproofing is in good order. Very close to 94 and its easy to drive into the city, just be aware of some construction going on. Beds were comfortable and breakfast was fine. We'd stay here again as it was just what we needed.
reviews.title: Very nice place for a night before traveling by air

likes.liked: — Close to the airport, clean, friendly, roomy

reviews.text: I stayed at this motel in October, 2006. I needed a place to sleep for the night before flying out from Milwaukee the next morning, and it provided exactly that.
reviews.title: Great for a short stay.

likes.disliked: — Not many services around the area.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The property is located close off the freeway, with plenty of parking. It is in good condition, and clean. There is an Applebee's restaurant in the same parking lot. Staff was pleasant, and check-in was painless.
reviews.title: Baymont is actually La Quinta Inn/Milwaukee Airport at this address.

likes.liked: — Friendly helpful staff and their pet-friendly policies.
likes.disliked: — Too few nearby places to eat or shop.

reviews.text: I picked this hotel because my meeting was 90 minutes away, but my flight left at 5:30 in the morning from the Milwaukee airport.
reviews.title: about 2 minutes from the airport

reviews.text: The room was recently refurbished (converted from being a Baymont Inn) but still a bit worn in spots. There's an Applebee's across the parking lot, but not much else in the area. However, the airport is one or two exits down the highway, so I was able to wake up at 4:00 in the morning, shower, turn in my rental car, and be at the ticket counter by 4:30, which was perfect.
reviews.title: We're havin' waffles!

reviews.text: I really enjoyed this hotel. It turned out to be one of the more expensive of the five hotels we stayed in on this trip, but it was quite a nice place. I thought the beds weren't the softest ever, and definitely were comfier than the floor. But I lost the coin toss and was relegated to floor duty for the night. I do agree with the reviews that say the carpet was dirty. I had on gray socks and the bottoms turned to black by the time I took them off at the end of the night. So watch out!
reviews.title: If you like the floor...

reviews.text: The do-it-yourself waffle bar and food selection was quite nice. They had cereal, muffins, bagels, yogourt, orange juice, apple juice, coffee, milk, danishes, and of course the awesome waffles which made me want to stay here an extra night - just so I could have them the next day.
reviews.title: good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all it was a decent place, and I'd stay here again. I give it a rating of three as a hotel, but an extra point for the awesome waffle bar.
reviews.title: Great price and service

likes.liked: — Shuttle to airport, parking while out of town, good price

aka: La Quinta Inn Milwaukee Airport Hotel
